div.p:
N.ro 1X.
Extract of the Suplement Supplement of the XXVII. Week
1. From Germanie Germany. 1763
Month of May.
As Some Thing extraordinary remarcable remarkable is this Month,
the first Low-Dutch Sermon was kept at Zeist,
the first Day of Pentecost. The Congregation is
in Hope of a new Blessing therefrom, there was
a very great Auditory & very attent the first
Time.

Herrnhuth.
The following Brn. & Sisters have departed
their Life in this Month.
1 The single Sister Anne Johane Röshin.
The following is her own Account.
I am born the 27th. of Jan. 1745 at Lindheim.
in the third Year of my Age I came in the
Anstalt where I was happy & nimble.
In the 6th. Year I had by a Baptising Baptizing of a Child,
the first Feeling of our Saviour in my Heart.
Since that I intented intended to love him & to become a good
Child, & had by that means many happy Hours, but
my Selfminded Temper disturbed my Peace very
often & exerciced exercised my Sisters, which conferred all their
Love & Patiens Patience upon me. Ao. 1751 As the whole
Anstalt

Anstalt was to move from Weteravia to Hhuth,
then my Parents toock took me home to Lindheim
again. This cost me many Tears & I could't be
accustomd to live here a long while. My Parents took me for
a good Child, & I took Care not to loose lose this good
Credit they had for me. I begun to be proud, took myself
for good to too, but my poor Heart grew dry & indifferent
towards our Savr. at last I became disobedient
towards my Parents & quite reverse to my former
Disposition, so that they was at a loss what to do
with me. In this Condition my Heart was rest-
less & this continued till 1755. On good Fryday Friday as
my dear Parents very emphatically remembred to me
what our good Lord suffered & did for me, this brought me to
consider, how miserable I have ever since Slandereth my noble
Time away. This emberrassd embarrassed my very Soul & I deplord
to our Savr. wth. many Tears to forgive my Sins & bestow
Mercy on me anew, that I may feel his Nearness again.
Hereby I experienced how soon our Savr. is inclined
to draw near to his poor Worms & to forgive their
Sins & Iniquity.

From this Day I had began a new Period of my Life,
I had many happy Discourses in my Silence with my
Saviour, for all that I sometimes feeld felt my dry &
indifferent Heart. The Discourses deleiverd delivered to the Children
I could never hear without a reproach in my Heart,
& a Wish or Desire for a Opportunity to employ any
Children Years in such a happy Situation. I thought
it very hard for me to stay at home & desireth my
Parents
Parents to assist me in this my Wish. Our Savr. supported
my Desire & I got Leave & came to my great Satis-
faction the 15th. Sept. 1756 on in Herrnhuth. Some Days
after myn my Arrival I came in my Choir-House & lived
there very happy, thancked thanked our Savr. very often that he
brought me again in the Congregation. By the removal
in our new Choir-House, the 18th. Octob. & the Pedelavium
the same Day, I receivd a new Blessing, Our Seviour Saviour
absolved me anew & I put myself in his His Hand as
his own Property wth. a heartely heartily Desire to form & make
me according to his Hearts Desire.

The 6th. of Dec. I was receivd. into the Congregation, I was
from all my Heart ashamed about all the Blessings which
our dear Lord bestowed on such a poor Siner Sinner; now my
incessant Wish was: a true Love in my Heart towards
his Waunts Wants & a continual Feeling of his Nearness.
In the Time following I had many happy Conversations wth.
our Savr. & languishd very often in my Solitude after
the holy Comunion Communion! This Grace he bestowed sooner on
poor me as I could expect it, then the 9th. of July
1757. I heard the good Tiding that I was Candidat Candidate
& the 31 of Augs. I received our Lords Supper the
first Time! Now was my Desire to enjoy the Effect of his
Flesh & Blood to enjoy in my poor Soul & Body.
Our Saviour was very gratious gracious to me & I had after-
wards happy Days & Hours & when I feeld felt my naturel natural
dry & indifferent Heart & had no rest & weapt wept so long after
the only Friend of my Soul till I feeld felt his blessed
Nearness again
Anna Johanna Rösch, page 3
Nearness again. Now a new Scene was drawn
up in my Heart: I begun to feel, that I was not
sincere & upright, I did not like to see so much
in my Uncleaness Uncleanness in my Heart, I was afraid for
myself, & ashamed to tell a Body of. For all that
I begged to our Saviour to discover every Thing
what is in me & help me to a upright & true
Heart. My Labourers very tenderly reachd me
their Hands and assisted me and made me Courage
to give over every Thing what not will stand the Proof.
I deploreth by my Savr. to starve thro' his Flesh &
Blood what's unJesuslike & make me a Jesus-
like Girl. So far she herself in the Begin of
Ao. 1760.

From that Time She lernt herself better to know, grew
open & free towards her Labourers & became a tender
& sinerlike sinnerlike Heart towards our Saviour.
In her Outward Behaviour not easily any Thing could
be found to be censured, but her timerous timorous & bakward- backward-
keeping Temper caused to herself many melancholic
Hours. However our dear Savr. did in this respect very
much on her Heart; & She brought away her time very
happy & easy.

Ao. 1762 the 4th. of May: She was received & according
to her Desire blessed into the Sggle Sister Choir, to
the great Joy of her Heart & She went over wth. a comfor-
ted Heart into her new Choir. Her last Births-Day
the 27th. of January
She was
was a Day of Praise to her, especially the Watch-Words
were a great Rejoysing Rejoicing to her: Du hast meine Klage
verwandelt in einen Reigen. o du in Freuden-Oel
verwandler meiner Zährlein! She declard, she never
had such Watchwords in her Life on her Birth-Day.
In the Beginning of Febr. a gallaping galloping Consumption
sized upon her to the great Surprice Surprise of herself & every
Body who knowd her. She was before a heathy healthy & brisk Girl,
& on a sudden changed to the great Surprise of every
One. She was directly ready & set upon to go Home
& possitively positively declared to hear of nothing else. Her
Sickness encreaseth increaseth daily, but She was happy & allert alert
with her fellow Sisters, but sometimes She was
observed in the most happy Meditations & Conversation
wth. her Sevr. Savr. & that so deep, that She was not
present to herself & nobody could interrupt her.
When She recoverd again her Y Joy was inexpressible
about her Prospect to be expected. A! said She one
times, how it is to me I can't tell, when I think a
few Weeks past, I was as healthy a Girl as any One
of you, & now I see myself a Canditat Candidate to go to my
dearest Friend! I am full of Joy & Wonder!
The 30th. of April She became so weak that She
was forced to keep to her Bed, but thought herself to go
the next Day to go to her Work again. However
it soon discovereth itself that She would not rise
again
again. Her Companions began to be shocked, but She
herself was full aof Joy amp; thankfull that she had a
year still enjoy'd the Happiness in the Sgl. Sist.r. Choir.
Now She was quite chearfullcheerful to go to our Saviour
but nobody but She thought her blessed Moment
so near advanced. All were amazed as She in
the Morning the 3d. of May at 8 ao Clock, went over
glad & easy into the Heart of her bloody Friend, in
a Age of 18 Years 3. Month & 5 Days:
The Blessing of her Choir followed her joyfully & her
flying Soulwas accompanyed wth. a happy Liturgie.
